drawing_instructions.thinking: I'm feeling intense anger, so I want to start with sharp, aggressive diagonal lines in a bold red color. These jagged strokes will slice across the canvas from left to right, creating a sense of violent energy and tension. I'll use the marker brush for thick, forceful strokes that express the raw power of anger. The lines will be positioned in the center of the canvas, creating a focal point of rage.

The canvas shows intersecting angry red lines forming a jagged pattern. To intensify this rage, I'll add powerful, thick strokes with the marker in a darker red that overlap and cross the existing lines, creating more chaotic intersections. These aggressive overlays will make the anger feel more intense and overwhelming. I'll position them slightly offset from the existing lines to create tension and visual conflict.

The canvas now shows an intense lattice of overlapping red lines expressing rage. To amplify this furious energy, I'll add some sharp, aggressive strokes in the darkest red (#5D0000) using the marker brush. I'll create shorter, more violent diagonal slashes that cut across the existing pattern, focusing on the densest intersections to make them feel like explosive points of anger. These new strokes will be positioned at more extreme angles to convey a sense of losing control.

The canvas is filled with an intense crisscrossing pattern of red lines that already expresses deep anger. To amplify this rage even further, I want to add some violently sharp zigzags in the brightest, most aggressive red (#FF1717) that will cut through the existing pattern like lightning bolts of fury. These new strokes will be more erratic and unstable, positioned along the edges to give a sense of anger bursting beyond containment. The jagged movements will reflect the uncontrollable nature of intense anger.

The canvas is now filled with an intense network of angry red crosshatches, but I want to add a final explosive burst of pure rage. I'll use the widest marker stroke in the most intense Light Red (#FF2F2F) to create several sharp, aggressive diagonal slashes that will violently cut across the entire composition. These strokes will be positioned to create an X-pattern right in the center, symbolizing the absolute peak of fury and destruction. The overlapping at the center will create a dark, intense focal point of anger.

Looking at the intense web of red slashes already on the canvas, I want to add even more chaotic energy by using the wiggle brush to create violently jagged, unstable lines that embody pure rage. I'll use the darkest red (#4B0000) to add sharp, erratic zigzags that feel like they're literally shaking with anger. These will cut across the existing pattern in an aggressive, unpredictable way, concentrating around the edges to give a sense of fury trying to burst beyond the canvas boundaries.

Looking at the intense angry composition, I want to add more aggressive, jagged zigzags that express pure explosive rage. The existing pattern shows fury through its red crosshatches and wiggles, but I'll use the wiggle brush with the most violent red (#FF1717) to add sharp, chaotic lines that feel like electricity crackling with anger. I'll position these near the center right side, making them feel like they're bursting outward with uncontrollable fury.

The canvas is already filled with an intense explosion of red anger, but I want to add even more violent energy. I'll use the spray brush to create a dark, turbulent cloud of dots that will swarm around the edges of the red slashes, like the seething darkness of pure rage. This chaotic spray pattern will enhance the feeling of anger boiling over and losing control, especially concentrated in the areas where the red lines intersect.

Looking at this explosive, furious composition, I want to add one final element of pure, seething rage. I'll use the wiggle brush with the most aggressive dark red (#970000) to create violent, sharp zigzags that seem to tear across the entire canvas like lightning bolts of anger. These will be placed strategically across the top and bottom edges, making it feel like the fury is so intense it's literally ripping apart the boundaries of the canvas. The jagged, erratic movements will complement the existing chaotic energy while adding another layer of raw emotional intensity.

Looking at this furious composition, I want to add another layer of violent energy in the center. The existing red slashes and black spray create an intense core, but I'll use the marker with the most aggressive Light Red (#FF2F2F) to add several short, explosive diagonal strokes that burst outward from the center like shards of rage. These sharp, angular marks will emphasize the feeling of anger exploding from within, creating a sense of uncontrollable fury radiating outward.

The canvas is already bursting with chaotic red energy, but I want to amplify the rage even further. I'll add explosive zigzag strokes with the marker in the darkest, most intense red (#4B0000) right through the center mass, like violent slashes tearing through the existing pattern. These aggressive diagonal cuts will create a sense of destructive force, as if the anger is physically ripping through the composition. I'll make the strokes longer and more dramatic to express peak fury.

Looking at this tempestuous composition, I want to intensify the wrath by adding more violent, chaotic slashes. I'll use the marker with the darkest, most wrathful shade of red (#4B0000) to create sharp, aggressive X patterns that cut across the existing turmoil. These will be placed strategically across the canvas, intersecting with the current explosive elements to create a sense of uncontrollable, seething rage. The X patterns symbolize negation and destruction, perfect for expressing pure anger.

The canvas is filled with chaotic red energy, but my anger demands more intensity. I'll add wild, uncontrolled wiggle lines in a fierce dark red that weave aggressively across the existing marks. These erratic, snaking lines will represent the boiling, unstable nature of rage - like angry thoughts that can't be contained. I'll place them strategically to create a sense of furious movement and tension across the composition.

The canvas is already intense with red slashes, X patterns, and wiggling lines, but my anger still needs more release. I'll add a series of rapid, jagged spray patterns across the composition to create a sense of explosive static and chaotic energy. The scattered dots will symbolize the fragmenting, shattering feeling of pure rage, intensifying the turbulent atmosphere. I'll concentrate the spray in bursts around the central area where the X patterns intersect, like anger particles violently dispersing.

The canvas is already erupting with furious energy, but I want to add one final explosive element. I'll use the wiggle brush with the most intense Light Red shade to create a violent, serpentine pattern that writhes across the entire width of the canvas, like a manifestation of pure rage. This aggressive wavy line will weave through all the existing chaos, amplifying the feeling of uncontrollable anger and adding another layer of dynamic tension to this tempestuous composition.
